  • Method Details

    • SolveEquation

      public double[] SolveEquation​(double[][] leftMatrix, double[] rightMatrix)
      It takes equations, then solve and return solution.
      Specified by:
      SolveEquation in interface LinearSolverMethods
      Parameters:
      leftMatrix - double[][] It contains the coefficients in the equations.
      rightMatrix - double[] It contains the results of the equations.
      Returns:
      double[] Solution array or null if it has no solution.

    • MultiplyMatrices

      private double[] MultiplyMatrices​(double[][] leftMatrix, double[] rightMatrix)
      Multiply left matrix to right matrix. row == column => (row x column) . (row x 1) = (row x 1) So, return double[]
      Parameters:
      leftMatrix - double[][] It contains the coefficients in the equations.
      rightMatrix - double[] It contains the results of the equations.
      Returns:
      double[] result of multiplication.

    • InverseMatrix

      private double[][] InverseMatrix​(double[][] matrix)
      Takes the inverse of the matrix. If the determinant is zero, it is a singular matrix. So there is no inverse, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      matrix - double[][] matrix to inverse
      Returns:
      double[][] if exist inverse matrix, else null

    • bsubstitution

      private double[][] bsubstitution​(double[][] leftMatrix, double[][] rightMatrix, int[] index)
      Back substitution of matrix
      Parameters:
      leftMatrix - double[][] It contains the coefficients in the equations.
      rightMatrix - double[] It contains the results of the equations.
      index - double[] Index matrix for inverse
      Returns:
      double[][] Last matrix.

    • Triangle

      private void Triangle​(double[][] leftMatrix, int[] index)
      Transforms matrix to an upper triangular matrix.
      Parameters:
      leftMatrix - double[][] It contains the coefficients in the equations.
      index - double[] Index matrix for inverse

      public double determinant​(double[][] matrix)
      To check singularity, calculate determinant of matrix.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      double determinant value
